result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Lee Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: count 2, with credit for 92 days time served.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes: -Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.

-No contact with firearms.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.

-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention, and continued programming.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes:
-As to each count serve 30 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 09-16-2016 at 1:30pm in Branch 36.
*02-17-17/PRH - Defendant is non-compliance with probation conditions and is ordered to serve 30 days STRAIGHT TIME, with 26 days credit.
*04-21-17/PRH - Defendant has absconded. Court ordered the stayed condition time of 30 days imposed FORTHWITH.

Defendant Michael Lee Gonzalez in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Michael Lee Gonzalez in custody.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab

The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date, credit for 26 days; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Case adjourned for another probation review hearing in branch 36.

Defendant Michael Lee Gonzalez in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM
Branch 45 for Branch 36.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.

As to count 1:

The court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 2, with credit for 92 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.

As to count 2:

The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 1, with credit for 92 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As to each count Serve 30 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 09-16-2016 at 1:30pm in Branch 36.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention, and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment /Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail reinstated by the court.  All other condition of bail remain the same.
